subject: Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: hmm, to be honest, I haven t had much experience with TDD or JUnit till I started on my honors project  about a couple of months ago. I ve done much research
messageBody:
hmm, to be honest, I haven't had much experience with TDD or JUnit
till I started on my honors project about a couple of months ago.
I've done much research however and have written a small lab
excercise using TDD.

As for what makes me think its a good idea, well basically all the
articles I read and the people I've spoken to remark on two reasons
why people do not pick up TDD, firstly being the test-first concept
of it is difficult to grasp and secondly that they do not see the
benefits in using it.

Well Junit was designed to allow repeated testing and I figure if it
could be further extended to generate the basic test cases it could
save alot of time and effort on the tester's part.

I mean from personal experience I thought it was hell of a tedious
to generate all the assert statements usually needed to test a given
unit of code i.e. a method. So I thought why not auto generate some
test cases? I dont mean all of them since testing is creative
work...but surely the basic few?

Stressed,
Jimm




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> junitheadache schrieb:
>
> > I am currently working on auto generation of test cases for TDD
for
> > my honors year project.
>
> Why? I mean, besides that you need to do a project - what tells
you that
> it would be a good idea?
>
> How much experience do you have with TDD?
>
> Curious, Ilja
>
